title: The Biden-Trump Presidential Debate
content: JAKE TAPPER, CNN MODERATOR: Weï¿½re live from Georgia, a key battleground state in the race for the White House. In just moments, the current U.S. president will debate the former U.S. president as their partiesï¿½ presumptive nominees, a first in American history. We want to welcome our viewers in the United States and around the world to our studios in Atlanta. This is the CNN presidential debate. DANA BASH, CNN MODERATOR: This debate is being produced by CNN and itï¿½s coming to you live on CNN, CNN International, CNN.com, CNN Max, and CNN Espanol. This is a pivotal moment between President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump in their rematch for the nationï¿½s highest office. Each will make his case to the American people with just over four months until Election Day. Good evening. Iï¿½m Dana Bash, anchor of CNNï¿½s ï¿½Inside Politicsï¿½ and co-anchor of ï¿½State Of The Union.ï¿½ TAPPER: Iï¿½m Jake Tapper, anchor of CNNï¿½s ï¿½The Leadï¿½ and co-anchor of ï¿½State Of The Union.ï¿½ Dana and I will co-moderate this evening. Our job is to facilitate a debate between the two candidates tonight. Before we introduce them, we want to share the rules of the debate with the ... it for 42 years. But you know what we did for the military was incredible. Choice for our soldiers, where our soldiers, instead of waiting for three months to see a doctor, can go out and get themselves fixed up and readied up, and take care of themselves and theyï¿½re living. And thatï¿½s why I had the highest approval rating of the history of the V.A. So, all of these things ï¿½ weï¿½re in a failing nation, but itï¿½s not going to be failing anymore. Weï¿½re going to make it great again. BASH: Thank you, former President Trump, President Biden.
